item.title: Live Spectrograms
item.description: Spectrograms allow us to see the differences between our voice and others that we cannot hear. If we only had our hearing for feedback we would be fumbling around in the dark while practicing and may never get anywhere. But with spectrograms we can had as systematic method we can execute that doesn’t rely on us being able to hear the subtleties of our voice. Pitch The pitch harmonic overlays will allow you to use sight to see if you are singing on pitch rather than your hearing.

item.title: Recordings
item.description: The trouble with spectrograms is that some qualities of speech we perceive are extremely subtle. For example we probably have evolved to read peoples emotional state from their voice. However, one could not read this from a spectrogram. Partly this is because the spectrogram loses information, and partly because our perception of sound is far more detailed in these specialized domains than our visual perception. We will need to listen back to recordings of ourselves, because we do not hear ourselves properly when speaking.

item.title: Pronunciation Checker
item.description: In a speed typing test, one types out a text and the computer can stop you preceding to the next word if you make a mistake. Just so I would like to make a speech recognition engine that will not proceed to the next word as you read aloud the text.

item.title: Segmentation Trainer
item.description: When you mispronounce a word can you break what you said down into atomic sounds can compare it to the correct pronounciation segmented into atomic sounds? If not you need to work on your phonetic segmentation ability. Phoneme segmentation is the ability to derive the correct sequence of sounds that make up a word. It is a critical specialized ability to develop if you want to be considered intelligent. English’s spelling system is not phonetic and so does not force you to develop this ability.
